title: LEGO Justice League Rocks, Exclusive Mark Hamill Clip - Kinda Funny Reacts
description:
Greg and Nick saw LEGO DC Comics Super Heroes: Justice League: Attack of the Legion of Doom, and they think you should see it. Plus, they have an exclusive Mark Hamill clip to show you.

Get everything early here: http://www.patreon.com/kindafunny

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=gameovergreggy

This video was edited on an ORIGIN PC EVO15-S Laptop. Get your PC here http://www.ORIGINPC.com.

Buy our shirts! http://www.districtlines.com/gameovergreggy

Each and every Friday, Greg Miller, Colin Moriarty, Nick Scarpino, and Tim Gettys get together to talk. Each podcaster brings a topic to the table, and then, they go. TV, space, books, movies -- anything goes.

Follow us on Twitter!
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/NoTaxation
Nick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_Scarpino
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys

transcript_chunks.text: what's up everybody I'm Greg Miller and this is the producer Nick Scarpino hi everybody look at me now hey how are you good uh Nick here's what I want you to know yes sir it's been a while but we we went to this thing called San Diego Comic-Con this the SDCC as the kids call it they do say it over there I hosted a panel where we saw a movie we screened a movie called LEGO DC Super Heroes: Justice League - Attack of the Legion of Doom yes very long title very good film now here's what I want to point out Nick is that I of course am the DC Comic superhero you know you know I love DC I die for DC it's what I'm all about I went to host this panel as the DC Fanboy so it's not it's not surprising to hear me say this movie was really good right but it blew my mind how good it was because I was expecting it's oh it's going to be a kids movie it's a LEGO Movie yeah and and so you you invited us to be a part of the panel and come watch and come support yeah um and we were more than happy to

expecting it's oh it's going to be a kids' movie, it's a LEGO Movie, yeah, and and so you you invited us to be a part of the panel and come watch and come support, yeah, um, and we were more than happy to not just because it was hot outside and they were actually airing an entire movie in air conditioning which was nice, yeah, very nice pro move, Pro maneuver, but also because you know we like support you and it's a DC movie and I love I love anything that has to do with DC animation, but yeah, when you when you have the LEGO Justice League and I was like okay this probably going to be skewed a little bit more toward younger younger audiences and we sat down and I was pleasantly surprised as was Tim how entertaining it is part of the thing that I liked about it was that it was very self-aware, yeah, and it as most of the LEGO properties do it very much knows what it's trying to be and it knows not only that but it knows how to have fun with that, yeah, which then translates very very quickly into a very

as most of the LEGO properties do, it very much knows what it's trying to be and it knows not only that but it knows how to have fun with that yeah which then translates very very quickly into a very entertaining experience. Soak in there is Batman so that's great already you got Cyborg in there this is this is the thing is like I I was late to the Teen Titans uh Cartoon in loving it you know what I mean but Teen Titans Go I watch it now I love it Cyborg's so good in it same cyborg here same and it's a it's a Cyborg Coming of Age story this this whole Legion of Doom storyline. But of course you have all this great interplay with all the villains all the heroes all these guys doing different things and like you're like I'm saying like you're saying it was cute for kids but then it was enjoyable as an adult and a huge man baby DC Fanboy yeah I thought it had a great angle to it and I think the tone was was spot on and again I'm a I'm a 74 year old man uh you wouldn't know it because I have

as an adult and a huge man baby DC fanboy yeah i thought it had a great angle to it and i think the tone was was spot on and again i'm a i'm a 74 year old man uh you wouldn't know it because i have great skincare regimen yeah but um no it was it was fun it was it was a blast and honestly it's one of those things where i would i would legitimately watch it again and that's the whole thing i was saying is like i tweeted about this when i left and what it was is that i'm gna i i'm going to buy this if you watched our game over greggy shows lately i was talking recently about how how weird it is to talk to people who aren't in our world where i had to reach out to my friends who have kids and stuff and be like do you have a blu-ray player do you have a dvd player cuz i want to buy them this movie and send them all copies of it anybody who has kids i want to send to this cuz all my friends are trying to make their kids athletic and have them play sports and do watch superhero stuff
